SEARCH
Package com.example.booking.service.monitoring.tasks

Interface MonitoringTask

All Known Implementing Classes:
BatteryLevelCheck, MemoryUsageCheck
public interface MonitoringTask
Interface for defining monitoring tasks for devices.

This interface specifies the structure for monitoring tasks that can be performed on devices. Implementing classes are expected to define specific monitoring actions, such as checking battery level, memory usage, or system load, by overriding the performCheck method.

Since:
1.0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

    getName()
    Returns the name of the monitoring task.

    performCheck(DeviceContext context)
    Performs a specific monitoring check on the given device context.

  • Method Details

    • performCheck

      void performCheck(DeviceContext context)
      Performs a specific monitoring check on the given device context.

      Implementing classes should provide the logic for a specific monitoring action within this method. The method receives a DeviceContext object, which includes information about the device to be monitored, allowing the implementation to access device metrics and other relevant data.

      Parameters:
      context - The device context on which the monitoring check is to be performed, encapsulating details about the device and its current state.

    • getStatus

      String getStatus()
      Returns the status of the last check performed by this task. Implementing classes should return a String representation of the status.
      Returns:
      A string representing the status of the task.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the name of the monitoring task. Implementing classes should return a String that uniquely identifies the task.
      Returns:
      A string representing the name of the task.
